content: Hello! I'm good. How about you? Can you say "안녕하세요" (annyeonghaseyo)? It means "Hello" in Korean. Can you repeat after me?
Nice to meet you, Mr. Kim Jae-kyung. Can you say "만나서 반가워요" (mannaseo bangawoyo)? It means "Nice to meet you" in Korean. Give it a try!
No problem! Let's try another word. Can you say "감사합니다" (gamsahamnida)? It means "Thank you" in Korean. Give it a try!
You're welcome! Since you mentioned watching, did you know that South Korea is known for its vibrant film industry? Korean movies like "Parasite" have gained international recognition and awards.
